citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection a 30 year old male Macaw hybrid, McGee, was observed in the bottom of his enclosure. The bird
was not standing, but sitting back on both legs. Some fecal material was noted on the tail feathers of the bird, perhaps
due to a preening issue. The bird interacted when spoken to. The licensee advised that he had been pulled from the flock
due to being "picked on". The behavior the bird was exhibiting was unusual and uncharacteristic.
Health and well-being of animals is important for animal exhibition. Due to the age, presentation, and potential preening
issue , a consultation with a veterinarian is needed.

At time of inspection three Sebastopol Geese were housed in an enclosure that only provided a small pool with a depth
less than one foot. This type of aquatic fowl have behaviors that require immersion and foraging. The pool provided does
not meet the appropriate standard to achieve this. To ensure social behaviors for the aquatic birds, an appropriate water
feature should be provided or relocate the birds to an area that would provide such.
To be corrected by: 8.22.25
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection a 30 year old male Macaw hybrid, McGee, was observed in the bottom of his enclosure. The bird 
was not standing, but sitting back on both legs. Some fecal material was noted on the tail feathers of the bird, perhaps 
due to a preening issue. The bird interacted when spoken to. The licensee advised that he had been pulled from the flock 
due to being "picked on". The behavior the bird was exhibiting was unusual and uncharacteristic. 
 Health and well-being of animals is important for animal exhibition. Due to the age, presentation, and potential preening 
issue , a consultation with a veterinarian is needed. 
3.153(c) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
At time of inspection three Sebastopol Geese were housed in an enclosure that only provided a small pool with a depth 
less than one foot. This type of aquatic fowl have behaviors that require immersion and foraging. The pool provided does 
not meet the appropriate standard to achieve this. To ensure social behaviors for the aquatic birds, an appropriate water 
feature should be provided or relocate the birds to an area that would provide such. 
 
To be corrected by: 8.22.25 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
